field.note: If selected, only assets in the statuses chosen will be listed. If no statuses are selected, assets to which the current user has effective read permission will be listed.
Only assets that are related to these nodes will be listed. Leave blank to list all assets related to this asset listing.
Only assets that are tagged by terms defined by these thesauruses will be listed. Leave blank to list all the related assets of the related nodes

Optional setting that defines the minimum number of levels below/above a root node an asset must be to qualify for listing. The immediate child/parent is level '1' for the purposes of this and the Maximum Depth/Height setting. Only makes sense when Direct Links Only is turned off.
Optional setting that defines the maximum number of levels below/above a root node an asset can be to qualify for listing.

Only assets that are linked underneath the root node(s) with the appropriate link types will be listed. The default is to show links visible in the asset map, that is TYPE_1 and TYPE_2 links. This setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned on.

A standard list displays all assets on a single page or can be broken up into multiple pages.
An A-Z listing displays search terms grouped by their first letter.
Custom Grouping allows a list based on user specifed grouping conditions.

Set to '0' (zero) to list all assets on the same page.
NOTE: This option is only valid when using the standard or custom grouping list formats..
If the listing type is Random, this defines how many assets are randomly displayed ('0' displays a single asset).
Keywords can be used to dynamically set the number of items on the page.

A Single Page will display all assets on one page, with headings for each letter in the list. When a user clicks a letter in the list of characters, it will automatically jump to that letter on the page.

This option only applies for a Single Page A-Z Listing.
Available keyword is %letter_group% which generates an anchored heading for each letter.
This is the text that will be printed to link to the previous results page
This is the text that will be printed to link to the next results page
Link text to a page containg assets in the A-Z list format which do not begin with A-Z, i.e. numbers or other characters

This format defines the individual layout of items on the listing's linked page list. If you are using the A-Z list format, this will define the individual layout of items on the linked character list. Available keywords: %page_link% and %page_number%.

This format defines the layout of the current page number on the listing's linked page list. If you are using the A-Z list format, this will define the layout of an item in the linked character list when no results are found under that particular letter. Available keywords: %page_number%.

If this is set to Yes, an additional "Page Contents (No Results)" bodycopy will appear, allowing you to specify different contents when there are no assets to list. Note that this is turned on by default.
